slashCommands.name: help
slashCommands.description: Sends info about the utility bot commands!

slashCommands.name: poll
slashCommands.description: Starts a new poll for users to vote on!

options.name: responses
options.description: A list of poll responses, separated by ';'

help: Type '<response>' in the thread to add a response to the poll.
Type 'remove <idx>' in the thread to remove a response by it's index (index el. [0, #reponses])
Question may be changed by typing 'question <question>' in the message's thread to change the poll's question.
Click the 'commit' button to finish editing the poll.
Reply 'edit' to the poll message to start editing again.
Reply 'resend' to the message or type 'resend' in the thread to resend the poll message in a channel.

slashCommands.name: roles
slashCommands.description: Creates a new message for adding and removing roles with buttons!

options.name: title
options.description: The title of the roles message

help: Select the roles you want to add to the message in a dropdown.
Only roles lower than bot's highest role will appear.
Navigate between the pages of roles with '<' and '>'.
Select the roles again to remove them from the message.
Click the 'commit' button to finish editing the roles message.
Reply 'edit' to the roles message to start editing again.
Reply 'resend' to the message to resend the roles message in a channel.
Reply '<new-name'> to change the title of the roles message.

slashCommands.name: config
slashCommands.description: Set up which roles are allowed to use a command

options.name: command
options.description: Select a command you want to change the allowed roles for.

options.name: role1
options.description: The first role allowed to use the command

options.name: role2
options.description: The second role allowed to use the command

options.name: role3
options.description: The thrid role allowed to use the command

help: This command may only be used by the administrators.
Select the command and up to three roles that may use the selected slash command.
Members without those roles are still be able to use some features of a command. (Example: They may vote on the poll, but they cannot start a new poll or add responses to the poll... )

roles.selectRolesToRemove: Select the roles you want to add or remove.

poll.replyToThread: Reply with the responses in the thread.

thread.name: Poll Thread
thread.reason: Adding responses and the question to the poll.

config.resetRoles: Reset allowed roles for `{0}`. Now everyone can use it and it's subcommands.
